intro: Argostemma parvum, commonly known as the small argostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a distinctive tubular shape. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest floors and stream banks.
